summary:
Greece, officially the Hellenic Republic, is a Southeast European country with a rich history. It is known as the birthplace of Western civilization, democracy, and the Olympic Games. The ancient Greeks lived in city-states called poleis. Philip II and Alexander the Great expanded their empire, spreading Greek culture. Later, Greece became part of the Roman and Byzantine Empires.

Modern Greece gained independence in 1830 and became a republic in 1924. It faced challenges like civil strife and refugee resettlement. Democracy was restored in 1974-75. Greece is a developed country with a strong economy, a founding member of the UN, and part of the European Union. It is famous for its tourism, shipping, and 19 UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
title: Greece
